info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 10 at 8:40PM EDT until July 10 at 10:15PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following county, Charleston. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 831 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gages indicate that between 3 and 6 inches of rain has fallen across Downtown Charleston today. Emergency Management reported that numerous roads across Downtown Charleston remained closed due to flooding. Flood waters are expected to slowly drain this evening. However, roads will remain flooded well into the nighttime hours. - Additional showers will pass across Downtown Charleston, possibly producing enough rainfall to slow the recede of flood waters. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Downtown Charleston, Daniel Island, West Ashley, Columbus Street Terminal, Medical University Of South Carolina, Marion Square, The Citadel and Cooper River Marina.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Areas most prone to flooding across Downtown Charleston include the Market, Crosstown, East Bay Street and Morrison Drive. Slow down when traveling and allow extra distance between you and the vehicle ahead. Do not drive into water of unknown depth.
